revised_title: Natural Strain and Geological Structure: Advances in Experimental Rock Deformation
tldr: This article discusses the relevance of laboratory rock deformation experiments to geological conditions and focuses on recent work on olivine and quartz. It highlights improvements in temperature capability and apparatus reliability, allowing exploration of higher temperatures and lower stresses and strain rates. The article also explores the different deformation mechanisms, such as cataclastic, crystal-plastic, and diffusional flow, and their implications for understanding rock behavior under various conditions.
